name: Fried Shrimp Tacos
description: This is one of my favorites, fried shrimp tacos that go along with its own unique salsa!
recipeIngredient: 1 clove garlic, minced, or more to taste
salt and ground black pepper to taste
1 pound raw shrimp - peeled, deveined, and halved lengthwise
salt and ground black pepper to taste
1 cup vegetable oil for deep frying, or as needed

recipeInstructions.text: Place 4 chopped roma tomatoes and arbol chiles in a saucepan. Add water; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium; simmer for 1 minute. Remove from heat; cool to room temperature.

Transfer cooled tomatoes and chiles to a blender or food processor. Add 1/2 of the cooking water, 1/2 chopped onion, cilantro, 1 tablespoon oregano, 1 clove minced garlic, salt, and pepper. Pulse 6 to 8 times to chop ingredients. Transfer mixture to a bowl; stir in 1/2 of the shredded cabbage. Cover and refrigerate until serving.

Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add 1/2 chopped onion; cook and stir until beginning to soften, 3 to 5 minutes. Stir in 2 cloves minced garlic and 2 diced tomatoes; cook 1 more minute. Add shrimp and 1 tablespoon oregano; cook and stir for 1 minute. Add 1/2 cup shredded cabbage, jalapeno pepper, salt, and ground black pepper. Cook and stir until shrimp turns opaque, about 3 minutes. Remove skillet from heat.
Heat oil in large saucepan to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Place 3 tablespoons of the shrimp mixture in the center of each tortilla. Fold in half. Place filled tortillas in hot oil, working in batches if needed. Fry until golden brown, about 3 minutes. Turn carefully with tongs. Brown the other side, about 3 minutes more. Transfer cooked tacos to a paper-towel-lined plate to drain.
Top with cabbage salsa and a slice of avocado.

review.reviewBody: No subbing on this lovely recipe. I’m 63 and this is the best recipe that I have ever used. I have followed hundreds of recipes. I rarely cook  from a recipe more than once. Too many recipes, too little time. This one is the exception.   I’m,thinking monthly. I won’t change anything except I will try with different proteins. Fish,chicken,pork,etc.   ThankYou times 1000
Absolutely delicious! The salsa was a bit spicy for my 5-year-old and 2-year-old but otherwise we loved it. My husband said, “This is a keeper.”

These were excellent! I forgot the avocado in the picture but I made as written and wouldn't change a thing. I have made a lot of fresh salsa but there was something about this one that really impressed me. 5 stars all the way!
Yes I made a lot of inspirational enjoyable dinners and i hope Allrecipes will always be around for my future quests
i followed this recipe and made zero changes. It was excellent and is now a go to dish for me!
I have a question,  the recipe calls for corn tortilla's, but those photoed don't look like corn,  are they white corn?

The taste is on-point with these fried tacos.  My 4 year old found the salsa a bit too spicy, but she liked her taco just fine topped with the avocado.  My husband and I really enjoyed the fresh kick of the salsa and the blend of shrimp/veggies in the taco.  The only tough part of this recipe was the corn tortillas being more delicate than flour ones. We prefer the taste of the corn tortillas, but when it was time to fry them, we did lose a few tacos to the oil as they broke apart so easily.  (We ate the broken ones even with half the filling spilled out... it was just that tasty!) Overall a good recipe that I would like to try again.

I did the recipe just as stated for the sauce and mine looks nothing like the picture. It has too much cilantro and not enough tomato. If you’re looking for something quick to fix this is not it. The recipe called for 1/2 head of cabbage chopped, but when it comes to the prep work all that I had to use according to the instructions was a fourth of a head plus a cup so I don’t know what we were supposed to do with the rest of it that was chopped. Also would’ve been nice if you gave an exact amount called for in the sauce because not all heads of cabbage are the same size. Mine was a very small head. I was so expecting this to taste awful but surprisingly it tasted pretty good. I think if I make it again I will add more tomato to the sauce and less cilantro. Seems all the corn tortillas I buy, no matter what  brand, want to fall apart immediately before you even put them in the skillet any more. I had the same problem with these tonight so it was a bit of a challenge. I just bought them at the store today so I know that they were fairly fresh. Thanks for the recipe. Definitely different.
